column1: Deletion of Data Items from the Birth and Fetal Death National Files
column2: Form(s) Affected
column4: Item(s)

column1: Source:
https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/deleted_items_from_birth_fetal_death_files.htm
(Page last reviewed: September 25, 2015; downloaded 6/19/2023)

The National Association for Public Health Statistics and Information Systems and the National Center for Health Statistics (NAPHSIS/NCHS) reviewed items on the 2003 national standard birth and fetal death data files to determine which, if any, should be cut from the files due to poor data quality and lack of potential for improvement. For data year 2014/2015 and beyond, NCHS no longer requires data be sent for these items.
*Item previously announced as dropped from the national birth file.
**All checkboxes on the national standard under this category have been dropped.
Items dropped from the national birth file:
Mother ever married (not standard marital status item or on standard birth certificate but part of national file)
column2: 2016 US Standard Mothers Worksheet for Child’s Birth Certificate
column4: 16. Have you ever been married?
